title: 11 Valentine’s Day Gifts for (Nature) Lovers
sub_head: Valentine’s Day can feel stale and artificial and—in frigid February—leave you housebound. Offer loved ones a little fresh air with gifts that nod to the great outdoors, from actually chic hiking boots to sculptural metal flowers.
body:
IN MUCH OF America, it’s freezing on Valentine’s Day. But that doesn’t mean your favorite people aren’t craving some fresh air. Some even enjoy being exposed to the elements for hours, embarking on frigid afternoon hikes or extremely brisk but nonetheless romantic after-dinner walks in the snow. This year, give someone you care about the gift of nature, whether it’s a pair of surprisingly chic boots to brave a slippery trail or—for those who appreciate houseplants but have inadvertently murdered every orchid that ever graced their home—some painted metal flowers. Here, 11 Valentine’s Day gifts for anyone who loves nature, or at least the idea of it.
If your Valentine struggles to keep even succulents alive, swap roses for painted metal flowers. Chicer than tacky fabric buds, they just might outlast your relationship. $150, GetTheGusto.com
